content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is how you can write this function in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code fences (i.e., triple backticks)
    matches = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, seed=1))
    
    # Extract the code blocks and remove the ```julia\n and \n``` at each end
    codes = join([replace(m.captures[1], "`" => "") for m in matches], "\n")
    
    return codes
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to find all code blocks that start with ```julia\n and end with \n```. It then removes these markers from the captured text, joining them together. 

Note: This assumes that there is only one language specified in each code block (i.e., "```julia") and not multiple languages are mixed within a single code block.
